definitions: a person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place

examples.text: police are appealing for witnesses to the accident
I was witness to one of the most amazing comebacks in sprinting history

shortDefinitions: person who sees event take place

definitions: a person giving sworn testimony to a court of law or the police

examples.text: a key witness at the trial
oral evidence set down in witness statements

shortDefinitions: person giving sworn testimony to court of law

definitions: a person who is present at the signing of a document and signs it themselves to confirm this

examples.text: a deed signed in the presence of a witness

shortDefinitions: person who is present at signing of document

examples.text: the memorial service was witness to the wide circle of his interest

definitions: used to refer to confirmation or evidence given by signature, under oath, or otherwise

examples.text: in witness thereof, the parties sign this document

shortDefinitions: used to refer to confirmation or evidence given by signature or under oath

definitions: open profession of one's religious faith through words or actions
shortDefinitions: open profession of one's religious faith

definitions: a member of the Jehovah's Witnesses.

phrases.text: call someone or something to witness

definitions: see (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place

examples.text: a bartender who witnessed the murder

definitions: be present as someone signs (a document) or gives (their signature) to a document and sign it oneself to confirm this
shortDefinitions: be present as someone signs document or gives their signature to document

definitions: have knowledge of (an event or change) from personal observation or experience

examples.text: what we are witnessing is the birth of a new political entity

shortDefinitions: have knowledge of development from observation or experience

definitions: (of a time, place, or other context) be the setting in which (an event or development) takes place

examples.text: the 1980s witnessed an unprecedented increase in the scope of the electronic media

shortDefinitions: be place, period, or setting in which event or development takes place

definitions: give or serve as evidence of; testify to

examples.text: his writings witness to an inner toughness

definitions: look at (used to introduce a fact illustrating a preceding statement)

examples.text: the nuclear family is a vulnerable institution—witness the rates of marital breakdown

shortDefinitions: used to introduce example that proves preceding statement

definitions: (of a person) openly profess one's religious faith

examples.text: our duty is to witness to God

phrases.text: call someone or something to witness
